vulnerabilities.title: HTTP Request Smuggling
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `apache2` package._

Apache HTTP Server versions 2.4.6 to 2.4.46 mod_proxy_wstunnel configured on an URL that is not necessarily Upgraded by the origin server was tunneling the whole connection regardless, thus allowing for subsequent requests on the same connection to pass through with no HTTP validation, authentication or authorization possibly configured.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:20.04` `apache2`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-17567)
- [CONFIRM](http://httpd.apache.org/security/vulnerabilities_24.html)
- [CONFIRM](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/re026d3da9d7824bd93b9f871c0fdda978d960c7e62d8c43cba8d0bf3%40%3Ccvs.httpd.apache.org%3E)
- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210702-0001/)
- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/SPBR6WUYBJNACHKE65SPL7TJOHX7RHWD/)
- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/ZNCYSR3BXT36FFF4XTCPL3HDQK4VP45R/)
- [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202107-38)
- [MISC](https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpuoct2021.html)
- [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/r7f2b70b621651548f4b6f027552f1dd91705d7111bb5d15cda0a68dd@%3Cdev.httpd.apache.org%3E)
- [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/r90f693a5c9fb75550ef1412436d5e682a5f845beb427fa6f23419a3c@%3Cannounce.httpd.apache.org%3E)
- [MLIST](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2021/06/10/2)
vulnerabilities.name: apache2/apache2-utils

vulnerabilities.title: HTTP Request Smuggling
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `nginx` package._

An issue was discovered in OpenResty before 1.15.8.4. ngx_http_lua_subrequest.c allows HTTP request smuggling, as demonstrated by the ngx.location.capture API.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:20.04` `nginx`.
## References
- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210129-0002/)
- [DEBIAN](https://www.debian.org/security/2020/dsa-4750)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-11724)
- [MISC](https://github.com/openresty/lua-nginx-module/commit/9ab38e8ee35fc08a57636b1b6190dca70b0076fa)
- [MISC](https://github.com/openresty/openresty/blob/4e8b4c395f842a078e429c80dd063b2323999957/patches/ngx_http_lua-0.10.15-fix_location_capture_content_length_chunked.patch)
- [MLIST](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2020/07/msg00014.html)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-11724)
vulnerabilities.name: nginx/nginx-common

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Verification of Cryptographic Signature
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `perl` package._

CPAN 2.28 allows Signature Verification Bypass.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:20.04` `perl`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-16156)
- [MISC](https://metacpan.org/pod/distribution/CPAN/scripts/cpan)
- [MISC](https://blog.hackeriet.no/cpan-signature-verification-vulnerabilities/)
- [MISC](http://blogs.perl.org/users/neilb/2021/11/addressing-cpan-vulnerabilities-related-to-checksums.html)
- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/SZ32AJIV4RHJMLWLU5QULGKMMIHYOMDC/)
- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/SD6RYOJII7HRJ6WVORFNVTYNOFY5JDXN/)
vulnerabilities.name: perl/perl-base

vulnerabilities.title: Reachable Assertion
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `tiff` package._

Reachable Assertion in tiffcp in libtiff 4.3.0 allows attackers to cause a denial-of-service via a crafted tiff file. For users that compile libtiff from sources, the fix is available with commit 5e180045.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:20.04` `tiff`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2022-0865)
- [MISC](https://gitlab.com/libtiff/libtiff/-/issues/385)
- [MISC](https://gitlab.com/libtiff/libtiff/-/merge_requests/306)
- [CONFIRM](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/cves/-/blob/master/2022/CVE-2022-0865.json)
- [DEBIAN](https://www.debian.org/security/2022/dsa-5108)
- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/ZQ4E654ZYUUUQNBKYQFXNK2CV3CPWTM2/)
- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/RNT2GFNRLOMKJ5KXM6JIHKBNBFDVZPD3/)
vulnerabilities.name: tiff/libtiff5

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Write
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `tiff` package._

A heap buffer overflow in ExtractImageSection function in tiffcrop.c in libtiff library Version 4.3.0 allows attacker to trigger unsafe or out of bounds memory access via crafted TIFF image file which could result into application crash, potential information disclosure or any other context-dependent impact
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:20.04` `tiff`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2022-0891)
- [CONFIRM](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/cves/-/blob/master/2022/CVE-2022-0891.json)
- [MISC](https://gitlab.com/freedesktop-sdk/mirrors/gitlab/libtiff/libtiff/-/commit/232282fd8f9c21eefe8d2d2b96cdbbb172fe7b7c)
- [MISC](https://gitlab.com/libtiff/libtiff/-/issues/382)
- [MISC](https://gitlab.com/libtiff/libtiff/-/issues/380)
- [DEBIAN](https://www.debian.org/security/2022/dsa-5108)
- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/ZQ4E654ZYUUUQNBKYQFXNK2CV3CPWTM2/)
- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/RNT2GFNRLOMKJ5KXM6JIHKBNBFDVZPD3/)
vulnerabilities.name: tiff/libtiff5

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Write
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `zlib` package._
_See `How to fix?` for `Ubuntu:20.04` relevant versions._

zlib before 1.2.12 allows memory corruption when deflating (i.e., when compressing) if the input has many distant matches.
## Remediation
Upgrade `Ubuntu:20.04` `zlib` to version 1:1.2.11.dfsg-2ubuntu1.3 or higher.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-25032)
- [MISC](https://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2022/03/24/1)
- [MISC](https://github.com/madler/zlib/commit/5c44459c3b28a9bd3283aaceab7c615f8020c531)
- [MLIST](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2022/03/25/2)
- [MLIST](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2022/03/26/1)
- [MISC](https://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2022/03/28/1)
- [CONFIRM](https://github.com/madler/zlib/compare/v1.2.11...v1.2.12)
- [MISC](https://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2022/03/28/3)
- [MISC](https://github.com/madler/zlib/issues/605)
- [DEBIAN](https://www.debian.org/security/2022/dsa-5111)
- [MLIST](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2022/04/msg00000.html)
vulnerabilities.name: zlib/zlib1g

advice.message: Your base image is out of date
1) Pull the latest version of your base image by running 'docker pull ubuntu:20.04'

summary: 16 medium or high or critical severity vulnerable dependency paths
